current_prd.elevator_pitch: We are developing a social networking web application that enables users to connect, share content, and interact in real-time. Our platform provides a user-friendly feed, profile management tools, and real-time updates, fostering a vibrant online community.
current_prd.problem_statement: Users need a platform to easily share their thoughts, experiences, and media with friends and followers. Existing platforms often lack real-time interaction and seamless content sharing, leading to a fragmented user experience.
current_prd.solution: A social networking web application with user-friendly interface, real-time updates, and comprehensive content sharing features. The platform will offer user profile management, a customizable feed, and an admin dashboard for content moderation and user management.

key_features.feature_description: Secure signup/login using email and social authentication
User profiles with bio, avatar, and settings
Users can post text, images, and videos
Users can like and comment on posts
Users can follow and unfollow other users
Posting, commenting, and liking without page reload
Continuous loading of content as the user scrolls
Content moderation, user management, and analytics
REST API for mobile app and third-party integrations
Horizontally scalable architecture to handle large user base
Log errors and exceptions for debugging
Monitor API response times and database query performance
Tools for system maintenance and updates
Tools for customer support and troubleshooting

phasing.rationale: This phase includes the core features required for a functional social media platform. Users can sign up, create profiles, post content, follow others, and interact with posts in real-time. This is launch-able to a small group of early adopters.

This phase focuses on providing the administrative tools and analytics necessary to manage the platform and monitor its performance. This is demo-able to stakeholders to showcase the platform's management capabilities.

This phase focuses on preparing the application for a larger user base and ensuring its security. Includes API for integrations. This is demo-able to stakeholders to showcase the platform's robustness.
This phase focuses on providing the tools necessary to maintain the platform and support users. This is demo-able to stakeholders to showcase the platform's maintainability.

user_stories.title: User Signup with Email

user_story.i_want: to sign up with my email address
user_story.so_that: I can create an account and start using the social web app

acceptance_criteria: Given I am on the signup page, when I enter a valid email address, password, and confirm password, and click 'Sign Up', then I am redirected to the profile setup page.
Given I am on the signup page, when I enter an invalid email address, then I see an error message.
Given I am on the signup page, when my password and confirm password do not match, then I see an error message.
Given I am on the signup page, when I enter an email address that is already registered, then I see an error message.

user_stories.title: User Login with Email

user_story.i_want: to log in with my email address and password
user_story.so_that: I can access my account and use the social web app

acceptance_criteria: Given I am on the login page, when I enter my registered email address and password, and click 'Log In', then I am redirected to my user feed.
Given I am on the login page, when I enter an incorrect email address or password, then I see an error message.
Given I have forgotten my password, when I click 'Forgot Password', then I am guided through the password reset process.

user_stories.title: User Profile Management

user_story.i_want: to manage my profile (bio, avatar, settings)
user_story.so_that: I can personalize my presence on the social web app

acceptance_criteria: Given I am logged in, when I navigate to the profile settings page, then I can update my bio, avatar, and other settings.
Given I update my bio, when I save the changes, then my updated bio is displayed on my profile.
Given I upload a new avatar, when I save the changes, then my new avatar is displayed on my profile.
Given I change my account settings (e.g., privacy settings), when I save the changes, then my account settings are updated.

user_stories.title: View User Feed

user_story.so_that: I can see posts from other users

acceptance_criteria: Given I am logged in, when I am on the user feed, then I see posts from other users.
Given I am on the user feed, when I click on a post, then I can view the post details, including comments and likes.
Given I am on the user feed, when I scroll down, then more posts are loaded (infinite scroll).

user_stories.title: Post Text and Images

user_story.so_that: I can share my thoughts and experiences with others

acceptance_criteria: Given I am logged in, when I am on the user feed or a user profile, then I can post text and images.
Given I post text or an image, when I submit the post, then it appears on my profile and in the feeds of my followers.
Given I try to post inappropriate content, when I submit the post, then it is flagged for moderation.

user_stories.title: Like Posts

user_story.so_that: I can show my appreciation for the content

acceptance_criteria: Given I am viewing a post, when I click the like button, then the post is liked and the like count is updated in real-time.
Given I have already liked a post, when I click the like button again, then the post is unliked and the like count is updated in real-time.

user_stories.title: Comment on Posts

user_story.so_that: I can engage in conversations with other users

acceptance_criteria: Given I am viewing a post, when I enter a comment and submit it, then the comment appears below the post in real-time.
Given I try to post an inappropriate comment, when I submit the comment, then it is flagged for moderation.

user_stories.title: Follow/Unfollow Users

user_story.so_that: I can customize my timeline with content from people I am interested in

acceptance_criteria: Given I am viewing a user profile, when I click the follow button, then I start following the user and their posts appear in my timeline.
Given I am already following a user, when I click the unfollow button, then I stop following the user and their posts no longer appear in my timeline.

user_stories.title: View Customized Timeline

user_story.i_want: to view a customized timeline of followed users' content
user_story.so_that: I can stay updated on the people I care about

acceptance_criteria: Given I am logged in, when I navigate to my timeline, then I see posts from the users I follow.
Given I follow a new user, when I refresh my timeline, then I see their posts in my timeline.
Given I unfollow a user, when I refresh my timeline, then I no longer see their posts in my timeline.

user_stories.title: Manage Users (Admin)

user_story.so_that: I can maintain the user base and address any issues

acceptance_criteria: Given I am logged in as an admin, when I access the admin dashboard, then I can see a list of all users.
Given I am logged in as an admin, when I select a user, then I can view and edit their profile information.
Given I am logged in as an admin, when I select a user, then I can deactivate or delete their account.

user_stories.title: Moderate Content (Admin)

user_story.so_that: I can ensure a safe and positive environment for users

acceptance_criteria: Given I am logged in as an admin, when I access the admin dashboard, then I can see a list of reported posts and comments.
Given I am logged in as an admin, when I select a reported post or comment, then I can review the content and the reason for the report.
Given I am logged in as an admin, when I review a reported post or comment, then I can choose to remove the content, ban the user, or dismiss the report.

user_stories.title: View Analytics (Admin)

user_story.so_that: I can understand platform usage and make informed decisions

acceptance_criteria: Given I am logged in as an admin, when I access the admin dashboard, then I can see analytics on user activity, content engagement, and platform performance.
Given I am logged in as an admin, when I view the analytics, then I can filter the data by date range and other relevant criteria.
Given I am logged in as an admin, when I view the analytics, then I can export the data in a common format (e.g., CSV).

user_stories.title: User Signup/Login with Social Auth

user_story.i_want: to sign up/log in with social authentication (e.g., Google, Facebook)
user_story.so_that: I can quickly create or access my account

acceptance_criteria: Given I am on the signup page, when I choose to sign up with a social media account (e.g., Google, Facebook), then I am redirected to the social media provider for authentication.
Given I successfully authenticate with the social media provider, then I am redirected back to the social web app and my account is created.
Given I have already signed up with a social media account, when I log in with the same account, then I am redirected to my user feed.

current_prd.tam_description: Total Addressable Market for the Global Social Media and Networking Platforms, encompassing all revenue generated from advertising, subscriptions, and other monetization methods across all social platforms worldwide.
current_prd.tam_estimation_basis: Based on global social media market revenue, including advertising, in-app purchases, and other revenue streams.
current_prd.tam_source: Statista Global Social Media Market Report 2023/2024, Grand View Research Social Media Market Analysis.
current_prd.sam_description: Serviceable Available Market for a new social networking platform focusing on real-time interaction, seamless content sharing, and community building, targeting young adults, content creators, and specific interest groups globally. This represents a segment of the broader social media market that values these specific features and community aspects.
current_prd.sam_estimation_basis: Estimated 20 percent of the TAM, focusing on users seeking enhanced real-time interaction, better content sharing, and community features, which are pain points identified in the PRD. This segment is less satisfied with existing platforms' fragmentation.
current_prd.sam_source: Analysis of social media user preferences, market segmentation by feature demand, and demographic penetration rates for target audiences (young adults, content creators).
current_prd.som_description: Serviceable Obtainable Market, representing the realistic market share a new social networking platform can capture within its SAM over a 3-5 year horizon, considering the highly competitive landscape dominated by established players.
current_prd.som_estimation_basis: Conservative 1 percent market share estimate over 3-5 years, acknowledging the significant barriers to entry and user acquisition challenges in a mature social media market. This assumes successful initial user adoption and retention.
current_prd.som_source: Competitive analysis of Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, TikTok market dominance, new social media platform success rates, and typical market penetration for new entrants in highly competitive digital markets.
current_prd.pricing_model_basis: Primarily ad-supported, with potential for freemium features or creator monetization tools in the future.
current_prd.advantage_summary: User-friendly interface, real-time updates, comprehensive content sharing, customizable feed, strong focus on fostering a vibrant online community, addressing fragmentation and lack of meaningful interactions.

planned.model_content:
class Post < ApplicationRecord
  belongs_to :organization
  belongs_to :author, class_name: "User"
  has_many :comments, dependent: :destroy
  has_many :likes, dependent: :destroy

  has_one_attached :image

  rhino_owner :organization
  rhino_references [:organization, :author]

  validates :content, presence: true
end
